Your outgoing setting looks a little odd to me. It should either be SSL/TLS and Port 465, or STARTTLS and Port 587. There is no point guessing though, you should check with your email provider what the correct settings are. Presumably they do have a support site with that information.

Which makes me wonder, is it not possible to have two versions of the same outgoing server when the description are different?

It is possible, just make sure have a unique description for each. And they should be for different accounts (i.e. user IDs).

Once the Outgoing Server settings are correct, you can link each server to the corresponding email account in your Account Settings. That works either by explicitly selecting the corresponding server for the account, or alternatively designate one SMTP server as 'Default' and just link the Default server to the account.

Will be happy to assist if this is an indication of a bug in the SMTP server setup mechanism of Thunderbird.

It's not.

content:
Thunderbird has the ability to merge incoming and outgoing emails on a particular thread. If email has threads because a conversation has been ongoing on a particular subject:

  • right click on email in thread and choose 'Open message in conversation'

It opens in a new tab showing all messages received and sent that relate to that email conversation.

Alternative option: If you want any replies you make to a received email to appear in the same folder as the original email: Example: You use filters and an incoming email gets put into a folder called 'Chess Club' You reply to that email and your sent copy gets put in 'Chess Club'.

You need to choose these settings for the account:

  • Account Settings > Copies & Folders

You will have your normal copies of new emails placed in the 'Sent' folder. But for replies to received email:

  • select checkbox 'Place replies in the folder of the message being replied to'
